snippet: Rodriguez, who has been under much scrutiny since being suspended for a year, has offered Yankees fans a ray of hope with his play so far this season, and they have responded warmly.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column holds that critics who claim New York Yankees infielder Alex Rodriguez has damaged his legacy by using performance enhancing drugs are not taking into account thousands of fans who seem to be as enamored with him as ever.
lead_paragraph: Rodriguez, who has been under much scrutiny since being suspended for a year, has offered Yankees fans a ray of hope with his play so far this season, and they have responded warmly.

headline.print_headline: In Yankees’ Reality Show, It’s Rodriguez, Flaws and All
headline.main: In the Yankees’ Reality Show, It’s Alex Rodriguez, Flaws and All
